title: Domain 1.2: Given a scenario, use the appropriate Microsoft command-line tool.
content:
🧭 1.2 – Navigation Commands (Windows CLI)

  • cd – Change directory
    Example: cd Documents
  • dir – List contents of current directory
  • md or mkdir – Make a new folder
    Example: md NewFolder
  • rmdir or rd – Remove empty folder
    Example: rmdir OldFolder
  • Drive navigation – Switch drives
    Example: C: or D:

🛠️ Core Command-Line Tools

  • ipconfig – IP info
    Example: ipconfig /all
  • ping – Test connectivity
    Example: ping google.com
  • hostname – Show computer name
  • netstat – List network connections and ports
  • nslookup – DNS troubleshooting
    Example: nslookup google.com
  • chkdsk – Scan/fix disk errors
    Example: chkdsk /f
  • net user – Manage user accounts
    Example: net user John /add
  • net use – Map network drive
    Example: net use Z: \\Server\Share
  • tracert – Trace route
    Example: tracert google.com
  • format – Format a drive
    Example: format E:

🧱 File Management & Utilities

  • xcopy – Copy folders and subfolders
    Example: xcopy C:\Source D:\Backup /s /e
  • copy – Simple file copy
    Example: copy file.txt D:\
  • robocopy – Reliable bulk copy tool
    Example: robocopy C:\Data D:\Backup /MIR

🧠 System Updates & Info

  • gpupdate – Refresh Group Policy
    Example: gpupdate /force
  • gpresult – Show applied policies
    Example: gpresult /r

🔌 System & Disk Utilities

  • shutdown – Restart/shut down system
    Example: shutdown /r /t 0
  • sfc – System File Checker
    Example: sfc /scannow
  • [command] /? – Show command help
    Example: xcopy /?
  • diskpart – Disk partitioning tool
  • pathping – Traces and tests latency/loss
  • winver – Show Windows version window
